questions.question: What is the primary spell card used to fuse monsters in the Branded Despia deck?
Which monster acts as a key material for Branded Fusion?
What effect does Mirrorjade the Iceblade Dragon have?
options: Destroys all monsters your opponent controls
Negates all spell effects on the field
Special summons a Despia monster from the graveyard

questions.question: Which of these cards is essential for recovering banished Branded spell cards?
What is a typical counter card used against Branded Fusion plays?
Which extra deck monster allows you to shuffle back materials into the deck?
What is the main advantage of Branded Opening?
options: Summons Fallen of Albaz from the hand
Adds Branded Fusion to your hand
Special summons a Despia monster and protects fusion monsters from destruction
Negates opponent's effects targeting your Branded spells

questions.question: Which Despia monster can modify the attack points of your opponent's monsters?
What is a popular tech card to counter opponent's monster-heavy boards with this deck?
Why is Aluber the Jester of Despia a key starter in this deck?
options: It special summons a fusion monster from the graveyard
It adds a Branded spell or trap from your deck to your hand
It negates effects targeting your Despia monsters
It banishes cards in the opponent's graveyard

questions.question: What happens when Fallen of Albaz is summoned and uses its effect?
options: It destroys all monsters on the field.
It fuses itself with an opponent's monster using their field materials.
It adds a Branded card from the deck to your hand.
It returns all cards to the deck.

questions.question: What is the effect of Branded Lost?
options: It adds Fallen of Albaz from the deck to your hand.
It prevents the activation of effects when a fusion monster is summoned.
It draws one card every time you summon a fusion monster.
It increases the attack points of all fusion monsters by 500.

questions.question: Which card can revive Fallen of Albaz or a Despia monster from the graveyard?
Which fusion monster can send itself to the graveyard to banish a card on the field?
What key effect does Despian Tragedy have when sent to the graveyard?
options: It searches for a Despia monster.
It destroys a card on the field.
It recycles a banished Branded card.
It special summons itself from the graveyard.
